column4: Sainsbury's moves swiftly to roll-out Argos digital stores
column5: LONDON  Sept 5 British supermarket group Sainsbury's said on Monday it planned to introduce Argos digital concessions to more than 20 additional stores by Christmas as it seeks to benefit quickly from its purchase of Home Retail.

column4: ABB names Nokia executive Jouret first chief digital officer
column5: ZURICH ABB has appointed Guido Jouret as its first chief digital officer  a move designed to ramp up the Swiss power and automation company's efforts in digital technology and the internet of things.

column5: ZURICH  Sept 5 ABB said on Monday it was appointing Guido Jouret as its first chief digital officer  a move designed to ramp up the power and automation company's efforts in digital technology and the internet of things.

column4: AIG raises $192 mln by selling remaining PICC P&C shares-IFR
column5: HONG KONG  Sept 5 American International Group  (AIG) has raised about HK$1.49 billion ($192 million) by selling its remaining shares in Chinese insurer PICC Property and Casualty Co Ltd  IFR reported.

column4: AstraZeneca seeks edge over rivals in severe asthma treatment
column5: LONDON AstraZeneca hopes to convince doctors its experimental injection for severe asthma has an edge over two approved rivals after clinical trials data on Monday showed it worked well when given just once every two months.

column4: Brazil's Banco Bradesco raising age limit to keep CEO Trabuco -source
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 5 Shareholders of Brazil's Banco Bradesco SA will vote on Oct. 7 on a proposal to change the age limit for its chief executive to 67 years from the current 65 years  the bank said in a securities filing on Monday.

column4: Woodside buys half of BHP's stake in Australian gas fields for $400 mln
column5: MELBOURNE  Sept 5 Woodside Petroleum  has agreed to buy half of BHP Billiton's  stake in the Scarborough area gas fields off Western Australia for $400 million  in a move that could help speed a decision to develop the long delayed project.

column4: Casey closes in on Deutsche Bank win
column5: By relinquishing his European Tour card to focus on the U.S. circuit Paul Casey gave up any chance of making this month's Ryder Cup team  but the Briton will feel that decision has been vindicated if he wins the Deutsche Bank Championship on Monday.

column4: Colombia's Cano Limon pipeline hit by leftist ELN rebel attack
column5: BOGOTA  Sept 5 A leftist rebel bomb attack has halted pumping operations along Colombia's second most important oil pipeline  the Cano-Limon Covenas  state oil company Ecopetrol said on Monday.

column4: Brazil banks get early antitrust approval for credit bureau
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 5 A preliminary report from Brazil's antitrust authority Cade recommended approval of a joint venture by Brazil's largest banks to start a credit research bureau  the agency said on Monday.

column4: RPT-EXCLUSIVE-Ford shelves compact car programme for emerging markets  setback for India
column5: NEW DELHI/DETROIT  Sept 2 Ford Motor Co  has shelved plans to produce a new compact car family designed mainly for emerging markets like India and China  industry sources said  reflecting disappointing sales of mainstream models in the world's fastest growing car markets.

column4: General Motors settles last bellwether ignition-switch cases
column5: General Motors Co  said on Monday it settled the last two so-called bellwether cases stemming from a faulty ignition switch linked to 124 deaths and 275 injuries.

column5: LONDON  Sept 5 (IFR) - Barclays has poached another executive from JP Morgan to head its investment bank  leaving the British bank with seven of its most senior bankers as alumni of its US rival.

column5: HOUSTON/NEW YORK  Sept 5 Saudi Aramco  and its U.S. refining joint-venture Motiva Enterprises lead the race to buy LyondellBasell Industries Houston refinery  according to three sources familiar with the matter.

column4: Bayer in advanced talks with Monsanto for deal
column5: Sept 5 German drugmaker Bayer AG said on Monday it was in advanced talks to acquire Monsanto Co  and was raising its offer for the U.S. seed producer.

column4: Volkswagen to supply engines in exchange for Navistar stake: sources

column4: Volkswagen to take 19.9 percent stake in Navistar for $16 per share: source
column5: FRANKFURT Volkswagen  will take a 19.9 percent stake in U.S.-based rival Navistar International Corp  for around $16 per share as part of a partnership deal  a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: Volkswagen to take 19.9 pct stake in Navistar for $16/shr - source

column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 5 Volkswagen's  commercial vehicles division is close to announcing a partnership with United States based rival Navistar  three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

column4: Tata applies to set aside DoCoMo court order on asset claims
column5: NEW DELHI  Sept 5 Tata Sons Ltd said on Monday it had made an application to set aside an order obtained by NTT DoCoMo from a London court that would allow the Japanese company to lay claim to Tata's overseas assets to settle a dispute over Tata Teleservices.

column4: Brazil bans third builder from government work for Petrobras bribes
column5: BRASILIA  Sept 5 Brazil on Monday banned IESA Oil & Gas from government work for paying bribes  the third construction and engineering company barred in the massive graft and political kickbacks scandal involving contracts with state oil company Petrobras.

column4: Australia new vehicle sales rebound in August-VFACTS
column5: SYDNEY  Sept 5 Sales of new vehicles in Australia rebounded in August with strong demand in the commercial sector auguring well for business investment.     The Australian Federal Chamber of Automotive Industries' VFACTS report on Monday showed 94 909 new vehicles were sold in August  up 4.6 percent on the same month last year. August this year had one more selling day and sales per day were up by 26.5 vehicles.     Sales were 3.9 percent higher than in July  though these figures are
